title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 03 February 2014 - XWiki

18:08 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
18:09 <cjd> that is very odd and potentially a bug, it seems that it's trying to persist an XWikiDocument with embedded attachments which it should definitely not be doing  
18:10 <cjd> Wanna go ahead and open an issue for that one too? We might close it as a cannot-reproduce but I think it's important that we keep track of it  
18:10 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
18:11 <kais3n> Regarding the attachment problem with creating new pages  
18:11 <kais3n> Is this related to? XWIKI-6205  
18:12 <cjd> no, I think it's different  
18:12 <kais3n> ok  
18:13 <kais3n> Ok so I will create two new tickets  
18:13 <vmassol> ah bot is back, good bot  
18:13 <vmassol> I coded it to be self healing, that's nice :)  
18:13 <kais3n> Should I put it under XWiki Platfrom?  
18:15 <vmassol> hmm I broke jenkins even more  
18:15 <cjd> the OOM issue should go under XWiki Platform --> OldCore  
18:15 <vmassol> (while trying to remove unnecessary plugins)  
18:15 <cjd> the other issue is XWiki Platform --> UI and Templates  
18:15 <cjd> (if I recall correctly)  
18:16 <kais3n> OOM  
18:16 <kais3n> ?  
18:16 <cjd> out-of-memory  
18:17 <vmassol> fixing  
18:20 <ClemensR> has quit  
18:20 <adm-dao2> has joined #xwiki  
18:21 <ansuz> has joined #xwiki  
18:21 <vmassol> ok back with some strangeness ;)  
18:21 <vmassol> tringgering a commons build  
18:21 <adm-dao2> Hello People, I was wondering if anyone knows how to edit permission in a specific page of an user thoough groovy script  
18:21 <vmassol> ahhhh no more jobs....  
18:21 <vmassol> ouch  
18:22 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
18:22 <cjd> yeah, apple has been going downhill ever since :(  
18:23 <Danilo\_> has joined #xwiki  
18:23 <adm-dao2> has quit  
18:23 <Danilo\_> Hello People, I was wondering if anyone knows how to edit permission in a specific page of an user thoough groovy script  
18:24 <cjd> Danilo\_: the answer is yes, how to do that is another question  
18:24 <vmassol> Danilo\_: check http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Setting+Rights  
18:24 <cjd> oh awesome, I was looking for something like that  
18:27 <Danilo\_> Can I use a velocity scrip inside a groovy script?  
18:27 <vmassol> you can output velocity from groovy but you should not need to do that normally  
18:29 <kais3n> What is the best way to added the java error to a JIRA issue?  
18:29 <kais3n> Monospaced?  
18:30 <cjd> {noformat}  
18:30 <cjd> <insert\_crap\_here>  
18:30 <polx\_> has joined #xwiki  
18:30 <cjd> {noformat}  
18:30 <Danilo\_> For example, in my case I have set a groovy listener and I want that when any user create a page in a specific space, so I will give privileges to other user (I want that this user could see just this page in the entire wiki..) In the "on event" function can I have put this velocity script?  
18:32 <polx> has quit  
18:32 <polx\_> is now known as <polx>  
18:32 <vmassol> Danilo\_: you can use groovy, you don't need velocity  
18:33 <vmassol> why would you want to use velocity inside a groovy script?  
18:33 <kais3n> Ok have a good evening  
18:33 <vmassol> the full xwiki api is available from all scripting languages  
18:33 <vmassol> kais3n: you too!  
18:35 <Danilo\_> Oh, now I understood, I need to translate the velocity example to a groovy syntax...  
18:35 <vmassol> yes but it's not hard it's the same thing  
18:35 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
18:35 <vmassol> remove the $  
18:35 <vmassol> well it's a bit more invovled but close  
18:36 <vmassol> for example instead of $xwiki it's xwiki  
18:36 <kais3n> has quit  
18:37 <Danilo\_> great, thank you!  
18:38 <cjd> has quit  
18:38 <ansuz> has quit  
18:38 <Danilo\_> has left #xwiki  
18:39 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
18:48 <vmassol> triggerd commons 5.4.x on ci to get a full rebuild of 5.4-snap  
18:49 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
18:56 <mflorea> vmassol: do you know why Groovy would use Servlet 3.0 API when I deploy an XWiki WAR on tomcat 7 (which comes with Servlet 3.0)?  
18:56 <mflorea> even if XWiki uses Servlet 2.4  
18:57 <vmassol> groovy will use the thread context class loader of the container  
18:57 <vmassol> xwiki war shouldn't contain any servlet jar  
18:57 <vmassol> that's provided by the container  
18:57 <mflorea> yes, but the the XWiki WAR specifies in its web.xml that it works with 2.4  
18:57 <vmassol> that's different  
18:58 <vmassol> the jar is still the 3.0 one  
18:58 <vmassol> now  
18:58 <vmassol> WDYM by "Groovy would use Servlet 3.0 API "  
18:58 <vmassol> ?  
18:58 <vmassol> "the jar is still the 3.0 one", actually I don't know about that  
18:58 <vmassol> but it's easy to check  
18:59 <mflorea> if I extend for instance XWikiServeltRequest it complains that the new 3.0 API methods from ServletRequest are not implemented  
18:59 <vmassol> you could print the CL's URLs for example  
18:59 <mflorea> extend in Groovy  
18:59 <mflorea> in a wiki page  
19:00 <mflorea> I'm surprised that the JARs from WEB-INF/lib, work and the code from the Groovy page doesn't  
19:00 <polx> has quit  
19:02 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
19:02 <vmassol> http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Vincent  
19:03 <vmassol> this one shows that file:/usr/local/apache-tomcat-6.0.36/lib/servlet-api.jar is used  
19:03 <vmassol> (for example)  
19:04 <mflorea> I get this  
19:05 <mflorea> [file:/usr/local/apache-tomcat-7.0.42/bin/bootstrap.jar, file:/usr/local/apache-tomcat-7.0.42/bin/tomcat-juli.jar]  
19:05 <mflorea> so it doesn't help  
19:05 <vmassol> this just means  
19:05 <vmassol> you're not checking the right CL  
19:06 <mflorea> in any case, the problem is I think that the Groovy code doesn't use the same Servlet API as the JARs in the WEB-INF/lib  
19:11 <cjd> is now known as <Guest82125>
